body.p: All but one of the lobes of the cerebrum can be seen from the outside. Which lobe is found deep to two other lobes?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This anterior lobe is protected by the frontal bone.
Incorrect. These two lobes are protected by the parietal bones.
Incorrect. These two lateral lobes are protected by the temporal bone.
Correct. This lobe is typically only seen if the temporal lobe is reflected or with a para-sagittal section of the brain.
Incorrect. This posterior lobe is protected by the occipital bone.

part.hint: All the superficial lobes have names associated with the cranial bone that protects them.

body.p: Which part of the cerebral cortex contains the visual center?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This lobe includes the primary motor area and Broca’s area involved in the formation of words.
Incorrect. This is the deep lobe whose function is not fully understood.
Correct. The visual sensory region is located in this posterior lobe.
Incorrect. This lobe includes somatosensory region, angular gyrus and part of Wernicke’s area for recognition of language.
Incorrect. This lobe includes auditory cortex and part of Wernicke’s area for recognition of language.

part.hint: The neurons carrying information from the eyes extend all the way posteriorly through the brain on an optic pathway.
